component.name: body
component.description: The body of the component. In markup, this is everything in the body of the tag.

css.name: class
css.description: A CSS class for the outer element, in addition to the component's base classes.

html.name: title
html.description: Displays tooltip text when the mouse moves over the element.

input.name: onfocus
input.description: The action triggered when the element receives focus.

input.name: onblur
input.description: The action triggered when the element releases focus.

input.name: tabindex
input.description: Specifies the tab order of an element when the Tab key is used for navigating. The tabindex value can be set to 0 or -1. The default is 0, which means that the component is focusable and participates in sequential keyboard navigation. -1 means that the component is focusable but does not participate in keyboard navigation.

input.name: accesskey
input.description: Specifies a shortcut key to activate or focus an element.

inputField.name: onblur
inputField.description: The action triggered when the input releases focus.

inputField.name: onchange
inputField.description: The action triggered when the value changes.

inputField.name: onfocus
inputField.description: The action triggered when the input receives focus.

select.name: name
select.description: Specifies the name of an input element.

select.name: value
select.description: Specifies the value of an input element.

select.name: variant
select.description: The variant changes the appearance of an input field. Accepted variants include standard, label-inline, label-hidden, and label-stacked. This value defaults to standard, which displays the label above the field. Use label-hidden to hide the label but make it available to assistive technology. Use label-inline to horizontally align the label and input field. Use label-stacked to place the label above the input field.

select.name: disabled
select.description: Specifies that an input element should be disabled. This value defaults to false.

select.name: readonly
select.description: Specifies that an input field is read-only. This value defaults to false.

select.name: validity
select.description: Represents the validity states that an element can be in, with respect to constraint validation.

select.name: onchange
select.description: The action triggered when a value attribute changes

component.name: access
component.description: Indicates whether the component can be used outside of its own namespace. Possible values are public (default), and global.

component.name: controller
component.description: The server-side controller class for the component in the format namespace.myController or myController if using the default namespace.

component.name: extensible
component.description: Set to true if the component can be extended. The default is false.

component.name: implements
component.description: A comma-separated list of interfaces that the component implements.

component.name: isTemplate
component.description: Set to true if the component is a template. The default is false. A template must have isTemplate="true" set in its aura:component tag.

component.name: template
component.description: The template for this component. A template bootstraps loading of the framework and app. The default template is aura:template. You can customize the template by creating your own component that extends the default template

if.name: isTrue
if.description: An expression that must be fulfilled in order to display the body.

if.name: else
if.description: The alternative to render when isTrue evaluates to false, and the body is not rendered. Should always be set using the aura:set tag.

iteration.name: items
iteration.description: The collection of data to iterate over

iteration.name: var
iteration.description: The name of the variable to use for each item inside the iteration

iteration.name: indexVar
iteration.description: The name of variable to use for the index of each item inside the iteration

iteration.name: start
iteration.description: The index of the collection to start at (inclusive)

iteration.name: end
iteration.description: The index of the collection to end at (exclusive)

iteration.name: loaded
iteration.description: True if the iteration has finished loading the set of templates.

iteration.name: template
iteration.description: The template that is used to generate components. By default, this is set from the body markup on first load.

renderIf.name: isTrue
renderIf.description: An expression that must be fulfilled in order to display the body.

renderIf.name: else
renderIf.description: The alternative content to render when isTrue evaluates to false, and the body is not rendered. Set using the <aura:set> tag.

template.name: auraPreInitBlock
template.description: The block of content that is rendered before Aura initialization.

template.name: doctype
template.description: The DOCTYPE declaration for the template.

template.name: errorTitle
template.description: Error title when an error has occured.

unescapedHtml.name: value
unescapedHtml.description: The string that should be rendered as unescaped HTML.

attribute.name: access
attribute.description: Indicates whether the attribute can be used outside of its own namespace. Possible values are public (default), and global, and private.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: Required. The name of the attribute. For example, if you set <aura:attribute name="isTrue" type="Boolean" /> on a component called aura:newCmp, you can set this attribute when you instantiate the component; for example,<aura:newCmp isTrue="false"/>

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: Required. The type of the attribute. For a list of basic types supported, see Basic Types. [https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.lightning.meta/lightning/ref_attr_types_basic.htm]

attribute.name: default
attribute.description: The default value for the attribute, which can be overwritten as needed. When setting a default value, expressions using the $Label, $Locale, and $Browser global value providers are supported. Alternatively, to set a dynamic default, use an init event. See Invoking Actions on Component Initialization. [https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.lightning.meta/lightning/js_cb_init_handler.htm]

attribute.name: required
attribute.description: Determines if the attribute is required. The default is false.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: A summary of the attribute and its usage.

accordion.name: activeSectionName
accordion.description: The activeSectionName changes the default expanded section. The first section in the accordion is expanded by default.

accordion.name: allowMultipleSectionsOpen
accordion.description: If true, all sections will be closed by default and the accordion will allow multiple sections open at a time.

accordion.name: onsectiontoggle
accordion.description: Action fired when the open sections change, it contains all open sections.

accordionSection.name: name
accordionSection.description: The unique section name to use with the activeSectionName attribute in the lightning:accordion component.

accordionSection.name: label
accordionSection.description: The text that displays as the title of the section.

accordionSection.name: actions
accordionSection.description: Enables a custom menu implementation. Actions are displayed to the right of the section title.

avatar.name: variant
avatar.description: The variant changes the shape of the avatar. Valid values are empty, circle, and square. This value defaults to square.

avatar.name: size
avatar.description: The size of the avatar. Valid values are x-small, small, medium, and large. This value defaults to medium.

avatar.name: alternativeText
avatar.description: The alternative text used to describe the avatar, which is displayed as hover text on the image.

avatar.name: fallbackIconName
avatar.description: The Lightning Design System name of the icon used as a fallback when the image fails to load. The initials fallback relies on this for its background color. Names are written in the format 'standard:account' where 'standard' is the category, and 'account' is the specific icon to be displayed. Only icons from the standard and custom categories are allowed.

avatar.name: initials
avatar.description: If the record name contains two words, like first and last name, use the first capitalized letter of each. For records that only have a single word name, use the first two letters of that word using one capital and one lower case letter.

badge.name: label
badge.description: The text that displays as the title of the section.

breadcrumb.name: label
breadcrumb.description: The text label for the breadcrumb.

breadcrumb.name: href
breadcrumb.description: The URL of the page that the breadcrumb goes to.

breadcrumb.name: onclick
breadcrumb.description: The action triggered when the breadcrumb is clicked.

breadcrumb.name: name
breadcrumb.description: The name for the breadcrumb component. This value is optional and can be used to identify the breadcrumb in a callback.

button.name: name
button.description: The name for the button element. This value is optional and can be used to identify the button in a callback.

button.name: value
button.description: The value for the button element. This value is optional and can be used when submitting a form.

button.name: label
button.description: The text to be displayed inside the button

button.name: variant
button.description: The variant changes the appearance of the button. Accepted variants include base, neutral, brand, destructive, inverse and success. This value defaults to neutral.

button.name: iconName
button.description: The Lightning Design System name of the icon. Names are written in the format 'utility:down' where 'utility' is the category, and 'down' is the specific icon to be displayed.

button.name: iconPosition
button.description: Describes the position of the icon with respect to body. Options include left and right. This value defaults to left

button.name: disabled
button.description: Specifies whether this button should be displayed in a disabled state. Disabled buttons can't be clicked. This value defaults to false.

button.name: onclick
button.description: The action triggered when the button is clicked.

button.name: type
button.description: Specifies the type of button. Valid values are button, reset, and submit. This value defaults to button

button.name: ariaLabel
button.description: Label describing the button to assistive technologies.

button.name: ariaDescribedBy
button.description: A space-separated list of element IDs that provides descriptive labels for the button.

button.name: ariaControls
button.description: A space-separated list of element IDs that this button controls the contents or presence of.

button.name: ariaExpanded
button.description: Indicates whether an element the button controls is expanded or collapsed. Valid values are 'true' or 'false'.

button.name: ariaLive
button.description: Indicates that the button will be updated. Valid values are 'assertive', 'polite', or 'off'.

button.name: ariaAtomic
button.description: Indicates whether assistive technologies will present all, or only parts of, the changed region. Valid values are 'true' or 'false'.

buttonIcon.name: name
buttonIcon.description: The name for the button element. This value is optional and can be used to identify the button in a callback.

buttonIcon.name: value
buttonIcon.description: The value for the button element. This value is optional and can be used when submitting a form.

buttonIcon.name: iconName
buttonIcon.description: The Lightning Design System name of the icon. Names are written in the format 'utility:down' where 'utility' is the category, and 'down' is the specific icon to be displayed. Only utility icons can be used in this component.

buttonIcon.name: iconClass
buttonIcon.description: The class to be applied to the contained icon element.

buttonIcon.name: variant
buttonIcon.description: The variant changes the appearance of buttonIcon. Accepted variants include bare, container, brand, border, border-filled, bare-inverse, and border-inverse. This value defaults to border.

buttonIcon.name: size
buttonIcon.description: The size of the buttonIcon. For the bare variant, options include x-small, small, medium, and large. For non-bare variants, options include xx-small, x-small, small, and medium. This value defaults to medium.

buttonIcon.name: disabled
buttonIcon.description: Specifies whether this button should be displayed in a disabled state. Disabled buttons can't be clicked. This value defaults to false.

buttonIcon.name: alternativeText
buttonIcon.description: The alternative text used to describe the icon. This text should describe what happens when you click the button, for example 'Upload File', not what the icon looks like, 'Paperclip'.

buttonIcon.name: onclick
buttonIcon.description: The action triggered when the button is clicked.

buttonIcon.name: type
buttonIcon.description: Specifies the type of button. Valid values are button, reset, and submit. This value defaults to button

buttonIcon.name: tooltip
buttonIcon.description: Text to display when the user mouses over or focuses on the button. The tooltip is auto-positioned relative to the button and screen space.

buttonIcon.name: ariaLabel
buttonIcon.description: Label describing the button to assistive technologies.

buttonIcon.name: ariaDescribedBy
buttonIcon.description: A space-separated list of element IDs that provides descriptive labels for the button.

buttonIcon.name: ariaControls
buttonIcon.description: A space-separated list of element IDs that this button controls the contents or presence of.

buttonIcon.name: ariaExpanded
buttonIcon.description: Indicates whether an element the button controls is expanded or collapsed. Valid values are 'true' or 'false'.

buttonIcon.name: ariaLive
buttonIcon.description: Indicates that the button will be updated. Valid values are 'assertive', 'polite', or 'off'.

buttonIcon.name: ariaAtomic
buttonIcon.description: Indicates whether assistive technologies will present all, or only parts of, the changed region. Valid values are 'true' or 'false'.

buttonIconStateful.name: name
buttonIconStateful.description: The name for the button element. This value is optional and can be used to identify the button in a callback.

buttonIconStateful.name: value
buttonIconStateful.description: The value for the button element. This value is optional and can be used when submitting a form.

buttonIconStateful.name: iconName
buttonIconStateful.description: The Lightning Design System name of the icon. Names are written in the format 'utility:down' where 'utility' is the category, and 'down' is the specific icon to be displayed. Only utility icons can be used in this component.

buttonIconStateful.name: size
buttonIconStateful.description: The size of the buttonIcon. For the bare variant, options include x-small, small, medium, and large. For non-bare variants, options include xx-small, x-small, small, and medium. This value defaults to medium.

buttonIconStateful.name: disabled
buttonIconStateful.description: Specifies whether this button should be displayed in a disabled state. Disabled buttons can't be clicked. This value defaults to false.

buttonIconStateful.name: alternativeText
buttonIconStateful.description: The alternative text used to describe the icon. This text should describe what happens when you click the button, for example 'Upload File', not what the icon looks like, 'Paperclip'.

buttonIconStateful.name: onclick
buttonIconStateful.description: The action triggered when the button is clicked.

buttonIconStateful.name: selected
buttonIconStateful.description: Specifies whether button is in selected state or not

buttonMenu.name: label
buttonMenu.description: Optional text to be shown on the button

buttonMenu.name: variant
buttonMenu.description: The variant changes the look of the button. Accepted variants include bare, container, border, border-filled, bare-inverse, and border-inverse. This value defaults to border.

buttonMenu.name: onselect
buttonMenu.description: Action fired when a menu item is selected. The 'detail.menuItem' property of the passed event is the selected menu item.

buttonMenu.name: menuAlignment
buttonMenu.description: Determines the alignment of the menu relative to the button. Available options are: auto, left, center, right, bottom-left, bottom-center, bottom-right. The auto option aligns the dropdown menu based on available space. This value defaults to left.

buttonMenu.name: iconName
buttonMenu.description: The name of the icon to be used in the format 'utility:down'. This value defaults to utility:down. If an icon other than utility:down or utility:chevrondown is used, a utility:down icon is appended to the right of that icon.

buttonMenu.name: iconSize
buttonMenu.description: The size of the icon. Options include xx-small, x-small, medium, or large. This value defaults to medium.

buttonMenu.name: disabled
buttonMenu.description: If true, the menu is disabled. Disabling the menu prevents users from opening it. This value defaults to false.

buttonMenu.name: visible
buttonMenu.description: If true, the menu items are displayed. This value defaults to false.

buttonMenu.name: alternativeText
buttonMenu.description: The assistive text for the button.

buttonMenu.name: name
buttonMenu.description: The name for the button element. This value is optional and can be used to identify the button in a callback.

buttonMenu.name: value
buttonMenu.description: The value for the button element. This value is optional and can be used when submitting a form.

buttonMenu.name: isLoading
buttonMenu.description: If true, the menu is in a loading state and shows a spinner. This value defaults to false.

buttonMenu.name: loadingStateAlternativeText
buttonMenu.description: Message displayed while the menu is in the loading state.

buttonMenu.name: isDraft
buttonMenu.description: If true, the menu trigger shows a draft indicator. This value defaults to false.

buttonMenu.name: draftAlternativeText
buttonMenu.description: Describes the reason for showing the draft indicator. This is required when the isDraft attribute is true.

buttonMenu.name: tooltip
buttonMenu.description: Text to display when the user mouses over or focuses on the button. The tooltip is auto-positioned relative to the button and screen space.

buttonMenu.name: onopen
buttonMenu.description: Action fired when the menu is opened.

buttonStateful.name: state
buttonStateful.description: The state of the button, which shows whether the button has been selected or not. The default state is false.

buttonStateful.name: labelWhenOff
buttonStateful.description: The text to be displayed inside the button when state is false.

buttonStateful.name: labelWhenOn
buttonStateful.description: The text to be displayed inside the button when state is true.

buttonStateful.name: labelWhenHover
buttonStateful.description: The text to be displayed inside the button when state is true and the button receives focus.

buttonStateful.name: iconNameWhenOff
buttonStateful.description: The name of the icon to be used in the format 'utility:add' when the state is false.

buttonStateful.name: iconNameWhenOn
buttonStateful.description: The name of the icon to be used in the format 'utility:check' when the state is true.

buttonStateful.name: iconNameWhenHover
buttonStateful.description: The name of the icon to be used in the format 'utility:close' when the state is true and the button receives focus.

buttonStateful.name: variant
buttonStateful.description: The variant changes the appearance of the button. Accepted variants include brand, destructive, inverse, neutral, success, and text. This value defaults to neutral.

buttonStateful.name: onclick
buttonStateful.description: The action triggered when the button is clicked

card.name: iconName
card.description: The Lightning Design System name of the icon. Names are written in the format 'utility:down' where 'utility' is the category, and 'down' is the specific icon to be displayed. The icon is displayed in the header to the left of the title.

card.name: actions
card.description: Actions are components such as button or buttonIcon. Actions are displayed in the header.

card.name: variant
card.description: The variant changes the appearance of the card. Accepted variants include base or narrow. This value defaults to base.

card.name: footer
card.description: The footer can include text or another component

card.name: title
card.description: The title can include text or another component, and is displayed in the header.

carousel.name: scrollDuration
carousel.description: The auto scroll duration. The default is 5 seconds, after that the next image is displayed.

carousel.name: disableAutoScroll
carousel.description: Specifies whether auto scroll is disabled. The default value is false.

carousel.name: disableAutoRefresh
carousel.description: Specifies whether the carousel should stop looping from the beginning after the last item is displayed. The default value is false.

checkboxGroup.name: name
checkboxGroup.description: The name of the checkbox group.

checkboxGroup.name: label
checkboxGroup.description: Text label for the checkbox group.

checkboxGroup.name: options
checkboxGroup.description: Array of label-value pairs for each checkbox.

checkboxGroup.name: value
checkboxGroup.description: The list of selected checkboxes. Each array entry contains the value of a selected checkbox. The value of each checkbox is set in the options attribute.

checkboxGroup.name: variant
checkboxGroup.description: The variant changes the appearance of the checkbox group. Accepted variants include standard, label-hidden, label-inline, and label-stacked. This value defaults to standard. Use label-hidden to hide the label but make it available to assistive technology. Use label-inline to horizontally align the label and checkbox group. Use label-stacked to place the label above the checkbox group.

checkboxGroup.name: messageWhenValueMissing
checkboxGroup.description: Optional message displayed when no checkbox is selected and the required attribute is set to true.

checkboxGroup.name: required
checkboxGroup.description: Set to true if at least one checkbox must be selected. This value defaults to false.

checkboxGroup.name: disabled
checkboxGroup.description: Set to true if the checkbox group is disabled. Checkbox selections can't be changed for a disabled checkbox group. This value defaults to false.

checkboxGroup.name: onchange
checkboxGroup.description: The action triggered when a checkbox value changes.

clickToDial.name: recordId
clickToDial.description: The Salesforce record Id that's associated with the phone number.

clickToDial.name: params
clickToDial.description: Comma-separated list of parameters to pass to the third-party phone system.

combobox.name: options
combobox.description: A list of options that are available for selection. Each option has the following attributes: label and value.

combobox.name: placeholder
combobox.description: Text that is displayed before an option is selected, to prompt the user to select an option. The default is "Select an Option".

combobox.name: dropdownAlignment
combobox.description: Specifies where the drop-down list is aligned with or anchored to the selection field. By default the list is aligned with the selection field at the top so the list opens down. Use bottom-left to make the selection field display at the bottom so the list opens above it. Use auto to let the component determine where to open the list based on space available.

combobox.name: messageWhenValueMissing
combobox.description: Error message to be displayed when the value is missing and input is required.

combobox.name: fieldLevelHelp
combobox.description: Help text detailing the purpose and function of the combobox.

combobox.name: spinnerActive
combobox.description: Displays a spinner to indicate activity in the dropdown list. This value defaults to false.

container.name: class
container.description: The CSS class for the iframe element.

container.name: src
container.description: The resource name, landing page and query params in url format. Navigation is supported only for the single page identified.

container.name: alternativeText
container.description: Used for alternative text in accessibility scenarios.

container.name: onmessage
container.description: The client-side controller action to run when a message is received from the contained content.

container.name: onerror
container.description: The client-side controller action to run when an error occurs when sending a message to the contained app.

datatable.name: columns
datatable.description: Array of the columns object that's used to define the data types. Required properties include 'label', 'dataKey', and 'type'. The default type is 'text'.

datatable.name: data
datatable.description: The array of data to be displayed.

datatable.name: keyField
datatable.description: Required for better performance. Associates each row with a unique ID.

datatable.name: hideCheckboxColumn
datatable.description: Hides or displays the checkbox column for row selection. To hide the checkbox column, set hideCheckboxColumn to true. The default is false.

datatable.name: hideTableHeader
datatable.description: Specifies whether the table header should be hidden.

datatable.name: resizeColumnDisabled
datatable.description: Specifies whether column resizing is disabled. The default is false.

datatable.name: suppressBottomBar
datatable.description: Specifies whether the inline edit Save/Cancel bottom bar should be hidden.

datatable.name: minColumnWidth
datatable.description: The minimum width for all columns. The default is 50px.

datatable.name: maxColumnWidth
datatable.description: The maximum width for all columns. The default is 1000px.

datatable.name: resizeStep
datatable.description: The width to resize the column when user press left or right arrow. The default is 10px.

datatable.name: sortedBy
datatable.description: The column fieldName that controls the sorting order. Sort the data using the onsort event handler.

datatable.name: sortedDirection
datatable.description: Specifies the sorting direction. Sort the data using the onsort event handler. Valid options include 'asc' and 'desc'.

datatable.name: defaultSortDirection
datatable.description: Specifies the default sorting direction on an unsorted column. Valid options include 'asc' and 'desc'. The default is 'asc' for sorting in ascending order.

datatable.name: showRowNumberColumn
datatable.description: Shows or hides the row number column. Set to true to show the row number column. The default is false.

datatable.name: rowNumberOffset
datatable.description: Determines where to start counting the row number. The default is 0.

datatable.name: enableInfiniteLoading
datatable.description: Enables or disables infinite loading. The default is false.

datatable.name: loadMoreOffset
datatable.description: Determines when to trigger infinite loading based on how many pixels the table's scroll position is from the bottom of the table. The default is 20.

datatable.name: isLoading
datatable.description: Specifies whether more data is being loaded and displays a spinner if so. The default is false.

datatable.name: maxRowSelection
datatable.description: The maximum number of rows that can be selected. Checkboxes are used for selection by default, and radio buttons are used when maxRowSelection is 1.

datatable.name: selectedRows
datatable.description: Enables programmatic row selection with a list of keyField values.

datatable.name: errors
datatable.description: Specifies an object containing information about cell level, row level, and table level errors. When it's set, error messages are displayed on the table accordingly.

datatable.name: draftValues
datatable.description: The current values per row that are provided during inline edit.

datatable.name: oncellchange
datatable.description: The action triggered when a cell's value changes after an inline edit. Returns the draftValues object.

datatable.name: onloadmore
datatable.description: The action triggered when infinite loading loads more data.

datatable.name: onrowselection
datatable.description: The action triggered when a row is selected. Returns the selectedRows object.

datatable.name: onsort
datatable.description: The action triggered when a column is sorted. Returns fieldName and sortDirection.

datatable.name: onheaderaction
datatable.description: The action triggered when a header action is clicked. By default, it also closes the header actions menu. Returns the action and columnDefinition objects.

datatable.name: onrowaction
datatable.description: The action triggered when a row action is clicked. By default, it also closes the row actions menu. Returns the eventDetails object.

datatable.name: onresize
datatable.description: The action triggered when the table renders columns the first time and every time its resized an specific column. Returns columnWidths.

datatable.name: onsave
datatable.description: The action triggered when clicking on the table footer bar's save button during inline edit. Returns the draftValues object.

datatable.name: oncancel
datatable.description: The action triggered when clicking on the table footer bar's cancel button during inline edit. All edited cells are reverted to their original values.

dualListbox.name: options
dualListbox.description: A list of options that are available for selection. Each option has the following attributes: label and value.

dualListbox.name: requiredOptions
dualListbox.description: A list of required options that cannot be removed from selected options listbox. This list is populated with values from options attribute.

dualListbox.name: values
dualListbox.description: A list of default options that are included in the selected options listbox. This list is populated with values from the options attribute.

dualListbox.name: fieldLevelHelp
dualListbox.description: Help text detailing the purpose and function of the dual listbox.

dualListbox.name: min
dualListbox.description: Minimum number of options required in the selected options listbox.

dualListbox.name: max
dualListbox.description: Maximum number of options required in the selected options listbox.

dualListbox.name: disableReordering
dualListbox.description: Set to true to hide the Up and Down buttons used for reordering the Selected list items.

dualListbox.name: size
dualListbox.description: Number of items that display before vertical scrollbars are displayed for the listboxes. Determines the vertical size of the dual listbox.

dualListbox.name: showActivityIndicator
dualListbox.description: Displays a spinner to indicate activity in the listbox. This value defaults to false.

dynamicIcon.name: type
dynamicIcon.description: The Lightning Design System name of the dynamicIcon. Valid values are: ellie, eq, score, strength, trend, and waffle.

dynamicIcon.name: option
dynamicIcon.description: The option attribute changes the appearance of the dynamicIcon. The options available depend on the type attribute. For eq: play (default) or stop For score: positive (default) or negative For strength: -3, -2, -1, 0 (default), 1, 2, 3 For trend: neutral (default), up, or down

dynamicIcon.name: alternativeText
dynamicIcon.description: The alternative text used to describe the dynamicIcon. This text should describe what’s happening. For example, 'Graph is refreshing', not what the icon looks like, 'Graph'.

dynamicIcon.name: onclick
dynamicIcon.description: The action triggered when the icon is clicked.

fileCard.name: description
fileCard.description: The description of the file, by default it is set to the filename

fileCard.name: hideDescription
fileCard.description: Hides the file description in the caption if enabled

fileUpload.name: label
fileUpload.description: The text label for the file uploader.

fileUpload.name: name
fileUpload.description: Specifies the name of the input element.

fileUpload.name: recordId
fileUpload.description: The record Id of the record that the uploaded file is associated to.

fileUpload.name: multiple
fileUpload.description: Specifies whether a user can upload more than one file simultanesouly. This value defaults to false.

fileUpload.name: disabled
fileUpload.description: Specifies whether this component should be displayed in a disabled state. Disabled components can't be clicked. This value defaults to false.

fileUpload.name: accept
fileUpload.description: Comma-separated list of file extensions that can be uploaded in the format .ext, such as .pdf, .jpg, or .png

fileUpload.name: onuploadfinished
fileUpload.description: The action triggered when files have finished uploading.

flexipageRegionInfo.name: width
flexipageRegionInfo.description: The width of the region that the component resides in.

flow.name: onstatuschange
flow.description: The action triggered when the interview’s status changes or a new screen is displayed.

formattedAddress.name: street
formattedAddress.description: The street detail for the address.

formattedAddress.name: city
formattedAddress.description: The city detail for the address.

formattedAddress.name: province
formattedAddress.description: The province detail for the address.

formattedAddress.name: country
formattedAddress.description: The country detail for the address.

formattedAddress.name: postalCode
formattedAddress.description: The postalCode detail for the address.

formattedAddress.name: latitude
formattedAddress.description: The latitude of the location if known. Latitude values must be within -90 and 90.

formattedAddress.name: longitude
formattedAddress.description: The longitude of the location if known. Longitude values must be within -180 and 180.

formattedAddress.name: disabled
formattedAddress.description: Specifies whether the address is clickable. This value defaults to false.

formattedAddress.name: showStaticMap
formattedAddress.description: Displays a static map of the location using Google Maps. This value defaults to false.

formattedDateTime.name: value
formattedDateTime.description: The value to be formatted, which can be a Date object, timestamp, or an ISO8601 formatted string.

formattedDateTime.name: hour12
formattedDateTime.description: Determines whether time is displayed as 12-hour. If false, time displays as 24-hour. The default setting is determined by the user's locale.

formattedDateTime.name: hour12
formattedDateTime.description: Determines whether time is displayed as 12-hour. If false, time displays as 24-hour. The default setting is determined by the user's locale.

formattedDateTime.name: weekday
formattedDateTime.description: Specifies how to display the day of the week. Allowed values are narrow, short, or long.

formattedDateTime.name: era
formattedDateTime.description: Allowed values are narrow, short, or long.

formattedDateTime.name: month
formattedDateTime.description: Allowed values are 2-digit, narrow, short, or long.

formattedDateTime.name: timeZoneName
formattedDateTime.description: Display style of the time zone. Allowed values are short or long. For example, the Pacific time zone displays as 'PST' if you specify 'short', or 'Pacific Standard Time' if you specify 'long.'

formattedDateTime.name: timeZone
formattedDateTime.description: The time zone to display. Use this attribute only if you want to override the default, which is the runtime environment's time zone. Specify a time zone listed in the IANA time zone database (https://www.iana.org/time-zones). For example, set the value to 'Pacific/Honolulu' to display Hawaii time. The short code UTC is also accepted.

formattedEmail.name: value
formattedEmail.description: The email address that's displayed if a label is not provided.

formattedEmail.name: label
formattedEmail.description: The text label for the email.

formattedEmail.name: hideIcon
formattedEmail.description: If true, hides the email icon so only the email address is displayed.

formattedEmail.name: onclick
formattedEmail.description: The action triggered when the email is clicked.

formattedLocation.name: latitude
formattedLocation.description: The latitude value of the geolocation. Latitude values must be within -90 and 90.

formattedLocation.name: longitude
formattedLocation.description: The longitude value of the geolocation. Longitude values must be within -180 and 180.

formattedName.name: firstName
formattedName.description: The value for the first name.

formattedName.name: salutation
formattedName.description: The value for the salutation, such as Dr. or Mrs.

formattedName.name: lastName
formattedName.description: The value for the last name.

formattedName.name: middleName
formattedName.description: The value for the middle name.

formattedName.name: informalName
formattedName.description: The value for the informal name.

formattedName.name: format
formattedName.description: The format for which to display the name. Valid values include short, medium, and long. This value defaults to long.

formattedNumber.name: style
formattedNumber.description: The number formatting style to use. Possible values are decimal, currency, and percent. This value defaults to decimal.

formattedNumber.name: currencyCode
formattedNumber.description: Only used if style='currency', this attribute determines which currency is displayed. Possible values are the ISO 4217 currency codes, such as 'USD' for the US dollar.

formattedNumber.name: currencyDisplayAs
formattedNumber.description: Determines how currency is displayed. Possible values are symbol, code, and name. This value defaults to symbol.

formattedNumber.name: minimumIntegerDigits
formattedNumber.description: The minimum number of integer digits that are required. Possible values are from 1 to 21.

formattedNumber.name: minimumFractionDigits
formattedNumber.description: The minimum number of fraction digits that are required.

formattedNumber.name: maximumFractionDigits
formattedNumber.description: The maximum number of fraction digits that are allowed.

formattedNumber.name: minimumSignificantDigits
formattedNumber.description: The minimum number of significant digits that are required. Possible values are from 1 to 21.

formattedNumber.name: maximumSignificantDigits
formattedNumber.description: The maximum number of significant digits that are allowed. Possible values are from 1 to 21.

formattedPhone.name: value
formattedPhone.description: Sets the phone number to display.

formattedPhone.name: onclick
formattedPhone.description: The action triggered when the phone number is clicked.

formattedRichText.name: value
formattedRichText.description: Sets the rich text to display.

formattedRichText.name: linkify
formattedRichText.description: Prevents the component from creating links in the rich text.

formattedText.name: disableLinkify
formattedText.description: Specifies whether the text should be converted to a link. If set to true, URLs and email addresses are displayed in anchor tags.

formattedTime.name: target
formattedTime.description: Specifies where to open the link. Options include _blank, _parent, _self, and _top.

formattedTime.name: label
formattedTime.description: The text to display in the link.

formattedTime.name: tooltip
formattedTime.description: The text to display when the mouse hovers over the link.

helptext.name: content
helptext.description: Text to be shown in the popover.

helptext.name: iconName
helptext.description: The Lightning Design System name of the icon used as the visible element. Names are written in the format 'utility:info' where 'utility' is the category, and 'info' is the specific icon to be displayed. The default value is 'utility:info'.

helptext.name: iconVariant
helptext.description: The iconVariant changes the appearance of the icon. Accepted variants include inverse, warning, error.

icon.name: iconName
icon.description: The Lightning Design System name of the icon. Names are written in the format 'utility:down' where 'utility' is the category, and 'down' is the specific icon to be displayed.

icon.name: size
icon.description: The size of the icon. Options include xx-small, x-small, small, medium, or large. This value defaults to medium.

icon.name: variant
icon.description: The variant changes the appearance of a utility icon. Accepted variants include inverse, success, warning, and error. Use the inverse variant to implement a white fill in utility icons on dark backgrounds.

icon.name: alternativeText
icon.description: The alternative text used to describe the icon. This text should describe what happens when you click the button, for example 'Upload File', not what the icon looks like, 'Paperclip'.

icon.name: src
icon.description: A uri path to a custom svg sprite, including the name of the resouce, for example: /assets/icons/standard-sprite/svg/test.svg#icon-heart

input.name: type
input.description: The type of the input. This value defaults to text.

input.name: label
input.description: Text label for the input.

input.name: formatter
input.description: String value with the formatter to be used for number input. Valid values include decimal, percent, percent-fixed, and currency.

input.name: files
input.description: A FileList that contains selected files. Use this attribute with file input type only.

input.name: isLoading
input.description: For the search type only. Specifies whether the spinner is displayed to indicate that data is loading. This value defaults to false.

input.name: placeholder
input.description: Text that is displayed when the field is empty, to prompt the user for a valid entry.

input.name: maxlength
input.description: The maximum number of characters allowed in the field. Use this attribute with email, password, search, tel, text, and url input types only.

input.name: minlength
input.description: The minimum number of characters allowed in the field. Use this attribute with email, password, search, tel, text, and url input types only.

input.name: pattern
input.description: Specifies the regular expression that the input's value is checked against. Use this attribute with email, password, search, tel, text, and url input types only.

input.name: autocomplete
input.description: Controls auto-filling of the field. Use this attribute with email, search, tel, text, and url input types only. Set the attribute to pass through autocomplete values to be interpreted by the browser.

input.name: fieldLevelHelp
input.description: Help text detailing the purpose and function of the input. This attribute isn't supported for file, radio, toggle, and checkbox-button types.

input.name: max
input.description: The maximum acceptable value for the input. Use this attribute with number, range, date, time, and datetime input types only. For number and range type, the max value is a decimal number. For the date, time, and datetime types, the max value must use a valid string for the type.

input.name: min
input.description: The minimum acceptable value for the input. Use this attribute with number, range, date, time, and datetime input types only. For number and range type, the max value is a decimal number. For the date, time, and datetime types, the max value must use a valid string for the type.

input.name: step
input.description: Granularity of the value, specified as a positive floating point number. Use this attribute with number and range input types only. Use 'any' when granularity is not a concern. This value defaults to 1.

input.name: checked
input.description: Specifies whether the checkbox is checked. This value defaults to false.

input.name: timezone
input.description: Specifies the time zone used when type='datetime' only. This value defaults to the user’s Salesforce time zone setting.

input.name: dateStyle
input.description: The display style of the date when type='date' or type='datetime'. Valid values are short, medium (default), and long. The format of each style is specific to the locale. On mobile devices this attribute has no effect.

input.name: timeStyle
input.description: The display style of the time when type='time' or type='datetime'. Valid values are short (default), medium, and long. Currently, medium and long styles look the same. On mobile devices this attribute has no effect.

input.name: accept
input.description: Specifies the types of files that the server accepts. Use this attribute with file input type only.

input.name: multiple
input.description: Specifies that a user can enter more than one value. Use this attribute with file and email input types only.

input.name: messageWhenBadInput
input.description: Error message to be displayed when a bad input is detected.

input.name: messageWhenPatternMismatch
input.description: Error message to be displayed when a pattern mismatch is detected.

input.name: messageWhenTypeMismatch
input.description: Error message to be displayed when a type mismatch is detected.

input.name: messageWhenValueMissing
input.description: Error message to be displayed when the value is missing.

input.name: messageWhenRangeOverflow
input.description: Error message to be displayed when a range overflow is detected.

input.name: messageWhenRangeUnderflow
input.description: Error message to be displayed when a range underflow is detected.

input.name: messageWhenStepMismatch
input.description: Error message to be displayed when a step mismatch is detected.

input.name: messageWhenTooLong
input.description: Error message to be displayed when the value is too long.

input.name: messageWhenTooShort
input.description: Error message to be displayed when the value is too short

input.name: messageToggleActive
input.description: Text shown for the active state of a toggle. The default is "Active".

input.name: messageToggleActive
input.description: TText shown for then inactive state of a toggle. The default is "Inactive".

input.name: ariaLabel
input.description: Describes the input to assistive technologies.

input.name: ariaLabelledBy
input.description: A space-separated list of element IDs that provide labels for the input.

input.name: ariaDescribedBy
input.description: A space-separated list of element IDs that provide descriptive labels for the input.

input.name: ariaControls
input.description: A space-separated list of element IDs whose presence or content is controlled by the input.

input.name: timeAriaLabel
input.description: Describes the time input to assistive technologies when type=datetime. On mobile devices, this label is merged with ariaLabel and dateAriaLabel to describe the native date time input.

input.name: timeAriaLabelledBy
input.description: A space-separated list of element IDs that provide descriptive labels for the time input when type=datetime. On mobile devices, this is merged with ariaDescribedBy and dateAriaDescribedBy to describe the native date time input.

input.name: timeAriaControls
input.description: A space-separated list of element IDs whose presence or content is controlled by the time input when type=datetime. On mobile devices, this is merged with ariaControls and dateAriaControls to describe the native date time input.

input.name: dateAriaLabel
input.description: Describes the date input to assistive technologies when type=datetime. On mobile devices, this label is merged with ariaLabel and timeAriaLabel to describe the native date time input.

input.name: dateAriaLabelledBy
input.description: A space-separated list of element IDs that provide labels for the date input when type=datetime. On mobile devices, this is merged with ariaLabelledBy and timeAriaLabelledBy to describe the native date time input.

input.name: dateAriaDescribedBy
input.description: A space-separated list of element IDs that provide descriptive labels for the date input when type=datetime. On mobile devices, this is merged with ariaDescribedBy and timeAriaDescribedBy to describe the native date time input.

input.name: dateAriaControls
input.description: A space-separated list of element IDs whose presence or content is controlled by the date input when type=datetime. On mobile devices, this is merged with ariaControls and timeAriaControls to describe the native date time input.

inputAddress.name: addressLabel
inputAddress.description: The label of the address compound field.

inputAddress.name: fieldLevelHelp
inputAddress.description: Help text detailing the purpose and function of the address compound field.

inputAddress.name: streetLabel
inputAddress.description: The label of the street field of the address.

inputAddress.name: cityLabel
inputAddress.description: The label of the city field of the address.

inputAddress.name: provinceLabel
inputAddress.description: The label of the province field of the address.

inputAddress.name: countryLabel
inputAddress.description: The label of the country field of the address.

inputAddress.name: postalCodeLabel
inputAddress.description: The label of the postal code field of the address.

inputAddress.name: street
inputAddress.description: The street field of the address.

inputAddress.name: city
inputAddress.description: The city field of the address.

inputAddress.name: province
inputAddress.description: The province field of the address.

inputAddress.name: provinceOptions
inputAddress.description: The array of label-value pairs for the province. Displays a dropdown menu of options.

inputAddress.name: country
inputAddress.description: The country field of the address.

inputAddress.name: countryOptions
inputAddress.description: The array of label-value pairs for the country. Displays a dropdown menu of options.

inputAddress.name: postalCode
inputAddress.description: The postal code field of the address.

inputAddress.name: disabled
inputAddress.description: Specifies whether the address fields are disabled. This value defaults to false.

inputAddress.name: required
inputAddress.description: Specifies whether the address fields are required. This value defaults to false.

inputAddress.name: readonly
inputAddress.description: Specifies whether the address fields are read-only. This value defaults to false.

inputAddress.name: showAddressLookup
inputAddress.description: Specifies whether to enable address lookup using Google Maps. This value defaults to false.

inputAddress.name: variant
inputAddress.description: The variant changes the appearance of the address compound field. Accepted variants include standard, label-inline, label-hidden, and label-stacked. This value defaults to standard. Use label-hidden to hide the label but make it available to assistive technology. Use label-inline to horizontally align the label and address fields. Use label-stacked to place the label above the address fields.

inputField.name: fieldName
inputField.description: The API name of the field to be displayed.

inputField.name: class
inputField.description: A CSS class for the outer element, in addition to the component's base classes.

inputField.name: value
inputField.description: The field value, which overrides the existing value.

inputField.name: onchange
inputField.description: The action triggered when the input value changes.

inputField.name: disabled
inputField.description: Whether or not the field is disabled. Defaults to false for readonly fields, true for other fields.

inputField.name: variant
inputField.description: The variant changes the label position of an input field. Accepted variants include standard (default), label-hidden, label-inline, and label-stacked. If variant is specified, the label position is determined by the variant. Otherwise, it is determined by the density setting of the parent form.

inputLocation.name: latitude
inputLocation.description: The latitude value. Latitude values must be within -90 and 90.

inputLocation.name: longitude
inputLocation.description: The longitude value. Longitude values must be within -180 and 180.

inputLocation.name: required
inputLocation.description: Specifies whether the compound field must be filled out. An error message is displayed if a user interacts with the field and does not provide a value. This value defaults to false.

inputLocation.name: disabled
inputLocation.description: Specifies whether the compound field should be disabled. Disabled fields are grayed out and not clickable. This value defaults to false.

inputLocation.name: readonly
inputLocation.description: Specifies whether the compound field is read-only. This value defaults to false.

inputLocation.name: fieldLevelHelp
inputLocation.description: Help text detailing the purpose and function of geolocation compound field.

inputLocation.name: variant
inputLocation.description: The variant changes the appearance of the geolocation compound field. Accepted variants include standard, label-hidden, label-inline, and label-stacked. This value defaults to standard. This value defaults to standard. Use label-hidden to hide the label but make it available to assistive technology. Use label-inline to horizontally align the label and geolocation fields. Use label-stacked to place the label above the geolocation fields.

inputLocation.name: label
inputLocation.description: Text label for the geolocation compound field.

inputName.name: salutation
inputName.description: Displays the Salutation field as a dropdown menu. An array of label-value pairs must be provided using the options attribute.

inputName.name: lastName
inputName.description: Displays the Last Name field. This field is always displayed if you set required to true.

inputName.name: options
inputName.description: Displays a list of salutation options, such as Dr. or Mrs., provided as label-value pairs.

inputName.name: required
inputName.description: Specifies whether the compound field must be filled out. A red asterisk is displayed on the Last Name field. An error message is displayed if a user interacts with the Last Name field and does not provide a value. This value defaults to false.

inputName.name: disabled
inputName.description: Specifies whether the compound field should be disabled. Disabled fields are grayed out and not clickable. This value defaults to false.

inputName.name: readonly
inputName.description: Specifies whether the compound field is read-only. This value defaults to false.

inputName.name: variant
inputName.description: The variant changes the appearance of the name compound field. Accepted variants include standard, label-hidden, label-inline, and label-stacked. This value defaults to standard. This value defaults to standard. Use label-hidden to hide the label but make it available to assistive technology. Use label-inline to horizontally align the label and name fields. Use label-stacked to place the label above the name fields.

inputName.name: label
inputName.description: Text label for the compound field.

inputName.name: fieldsToDisplay
inputName.description: List of fields to be displayed on the component. This value defaults to ['firstName', 'salutation', 'lastName']. Other field values include middleName, informalName, suffix.

inputName.name: fieldLevelHelp
inputName.description: Help text detailing the purpose and function of name compound field.

inputRichText.name: ariaLabel
inputRichText.description: Label describing the rich text editor to assistive technologies

inputRichText.name: ariaLabelledby
inputRichText.description: An element ID that provides a label for the rich text editor.

inputRichText.name: ariaDescribedby
inputRichText.description: A space-separated list of element IDs that provides descriptive labels for the rich text editor.

inputRichText.name: label
inputRichText.description: Text label for the rich text editor.

inputRichText.name: labelVisible
inputRichText.description: Specifies whether the label is visible or not. The default is false.

inputRichText.name: value
inputRichText.description: The HTML content in the rich text editor.

inputRichText.name: placeholder
inputRichText.description: Text that is displayed when the field is empty.

inputRichText.name: disabledCategories
inputRichText.description: A comma-separated list of button categories to remove from the toolbar.

inputRichText.name: disabled
inputRichText.description: Specifies whether the editor is disabled. This value defaults to false.

inputRichText.name: valid
inputRichText.description: Specifies whether the editor content is valid. If invalid, the slds-has-error class is added. This value defaults to true.

inputRichText.name: formats
inputRichText.description: A list of formats accepted by the text editor. By default, the list is computed based on enabled categories. The "table" format is always enabled to support copying and pasting of tables. If formats are specified, all desired formats must be specified. Omitting a format from the list removes the corresponding button.

inputRichText.name: variant
inputRichText.description: The variant changes the appearance of the toolbar. Accepted variant is bottom-toolbar which causes the toolbar to be displayed below the text box.

inputRichText.name: messageWhenBadInput
inputRichText.description: Error message that's displayed when valid is false.

inputRichText.name: shareWithEntityId
inputRichText.description: Entity ID to share the image with.

layout.name: horizontalAlign
layout.description: Determines how to spread the layout items horizontally. The alignment options are center, space, spread, and end.

layout.name: verticalAlign
layout.description: Determines how to spread the layout items vertically. The alignment options are start, center, end, and stretch.

layout.name: multipleRows
layout.description: Determines whether to wrap the child items when they exceed the layout width. If true, the items wrap to the following line. This value defaults to false.

layout.name: pullToBoundary
layout.description: Pulls layout items to the layout boundaries and corresponds to the padding size on the layout item. Possible values are small, medium, or large.

layoutItem.name: size
layoutItem.description: If the viewport is divided into 12 parts, size indicates the relative space the container occupies. Size is expressed as an integer from 1 through 12. This applies for all device-types.

layoutItem.name: smallDeviceSize
layoutItem.description: If the viewport is divided into 12 parts, this attribute indicates the relative space the container occupies on device-types larger than mobile. It is expressed as an integer from 1 through 12.

layoutItem.name: mediumDeviceSize
layoutItem.description: If the viewport is divided into 12 parts, this attribute indicates the relative space the container occupies on device-types larger than tablet. It is expressed as an integer from 1 through 12.

layoutItem.name: largeDeviceSize
layoutItem.description: If the viewport is divided into 12 parts, this attribute indicates the relative space the container occupies on device-types larger than desktop. It is expressed as an integer from 1 through 12.

layoutItem.name: flexibility
layoutItem.description: Make the item fluid so that it absorbs any extra space in its container or shrinks when there is less space. Allowed values are: auto (columns grow or shrink equally as space allows), shrink (columns shrink equally as space decreases), no-shrink (columns don't shrink as space reduces), grow (columns grow equally as space increases), no-grow (columns don't grow as space increases), no-flex (columns don't grow or shrink as space changes). Use a comma-separated value for multiple options, such as 'auto, no-shrink'.

layoutItem.name: padding
layoutItem.description: Sets padding to either the right and left sides of a container, or all sides of a container. Allowed values are horizontal-small, horizontal-medium, horizontal-large, around-small, around-medium, around-large.

layoutItem.name: alignmentBump
layoutItem.description: Specifies a direction to bump the alignment of adjacent layout items. Allowed values are left, top, right, bottom.

listView.name: objectApiName
listView.description: The API name of the object to be displayed in this List View

listView.name: listName
listView.description: The developer name of the List View

listView.name: rows
listView.description: Specifies the number of rows to initially load and additional rows after each subsequent 'Load More' click. The default and maximum number of rows value is 50

listView.name: showActionBar
listView.description: Specifies whether the action bar displays. This value defaults to false.

listView.name: enableInlineEdit
listView.description: Specifies whether the inline edit of cells is enabled. This value defaults to false.

listView.name: showRowLevelActions
listView.description: Specifies whether row level actions are displayed (as a dropdown menu in the last column of the row). This value defaults to false.

listView.name: showSearchBar
listView.description: Specifies whether the search bar displays. This value defaults to false. Note: The server side may still disable search if it does not support searching.

map.name: zoomLevel
map.description: Corresponds to zoom levels defined in Google Maps API. If not specified, the map component automatically chooses an appropriate zoom level to show all markers with comfortable margins.

map.name: mapMarkers
map.description: Array containing one or more objects with the address or coordinates to be displayed.

map.name: markersTitle
map.description: Provides the heading title for the markers when the map uses multiple markers. The title is displayed as a header for the list of clickable addresses.

map.name: center
map.description: A location to use as the map's center. If center is not specified, the map centers automatically.

map.name: showFooter
map.description: Shows footer with 'Open in Google Maps' link that opens an external window to display the selected marker location in Google Maps. Default value is false.

map.name: listView
map.description: Displays or hides the list of locations. Valid values are visible, hidden, or auto. This value defaults to auto, which shows the list only when multiple markers are present. Passing in an invalid value hides the list view.

menuItem.name: value
menuItem.description: A value associated with the menu item.

menuItem.name: iconName
menuItem.description: The name of an icon to display after the text of the menu item.

menuItem.name: checked
menuItem.description: If not specified, the menu item is not checkable. If true, a check mark is shown to the left of the menu item. If false, a check mark is not shown but there is space to accommodate one.

menuItem.name: disabled
menuItem.description: If true, the menu item is not actionable and is shown as disabled.

menuItem.name: onactive
menuItem.description: DEPRECATED. The action triggered when this menu item is selected.

menuItem.name: isDraft
menuItem.description: If true, the menu item shows a draft indicator. This value defaults to false.

menuItem.name: draftAlternativeText
menuItem.description: Describes the reason for showing the draft indicator. This is required when the isDraft attribute is true

menuItem.name: prefixIconName
menuItem.description: The name of an icon to display before the text of the menu item.

menuItem.name: href
menuItem.description: URL for a link to use for the menu item.

outputField.name: fieldName
outputField.description: The API name of the field to be displayed.

outputField.name: variant
outputField.description: Changes the appearance of the output. Accepted variants include standard and label-hidden. This value defaults to standard.

outputField.name: class
outputField.description: A CSS class for the outer element, in addition to the component's base classes.

path.name: variant
path.description: Changes the appearance of the path. Choose between linear and non-linear formats. In linear paths, completed steps show a checkmark. In non-linear paths, completed steps show the step name. We show linear paths by default.

path.name: hideUpdateButton
path.description: Specified whether the Mark Complete button is displayed next to the path. If true, the button is not displayed. The Mark Complete button is displayed by default.

path.name: onselect
path.description: The action triggered when a step on the path is clicked.

picklistPath.name: variant
picklistPath.description: Changes the appearance of the path. Choose between linear and non-linear formats. In linear paths, completed steps show a checkmark. In non-linear paths, completed steps show the step name. We show linear paths by default.

picklistPath.name: picklistFieldApiName
picklistPath.description: The API name of the field from which the path is derived. For example, StageName for Opportunity.

picklistPath.name: onselect
picklistPath.description: The action triggered when a step on the path is clicked.

pill.name: href
pill.description: The URL of the page that the link goes to.

pill.name: onclick
pill.description: The action triggered when the button is clicked.

pill.name: media
pill.description: The icon or figure that's displayed next to the textual information.

pill.name: hasError
pill.description: Specifies whether the pill has errors. The default is false.

pill.name: onremove
pill.description: The action triggered when the pill is removed.

pill.name: name
pill.description: The name for the pill. This value is optional and can be used to identify the pill in a callback.

pillContainer.name: items
pillContainer.description: An array of items to be rendered as pills in a container.

pillContainer.name: label
pillContainer.description: Aria label for the pill container.

pillContainer.name: singleLine
pillContainer.description: Whether keep pills in single line.

pillContainer.name: onitemremove
pillContainer.description: The action triggered when a pill is removed.

progressBar.name: variant
progressBar.description: The variant of the progress bar. Valid values are base and circular.

progressBar.name: value
progressBar.description: The percentage value of the progress bar.

progressBar.name: size
progressBar.description: The size of the progress bar. Valid values are x-small, small, medium, and large. The default value is medium.

progressIndicator.name: type
progressIndicator.description: Changes the visual pattern of the indicator. Valid values are base and path. This value defaults to base.

progressIndicator.name: currentStep
progressIndicator.description: The current step, which must match the value attribute of one of progressStep components. If a step is not provided, the value of the first progressStep component is used.

progressIndicator.name: variant
progressIndicator.description: Changes the appearance of the progress indicator for the base type only. Valid values are base or shaded. The shaded variant adds a light gray border to the step indicators. This value defaults to base.

progressIndicator.name: hasError

relativeDateTime.name: value

select.name: label
select.description: Text that describes the desired select input.

select.name: messageWhenValueMissing
select.description: Error message to be displayed when the value is missing.

slider.name: value
slider.description: The numerical value of the input range. This value defaults to 0.

slider.name: onchange
slider.description: The action triggered when the slider value changes. You must pass any newly selected value back to the slider component to bind the new value to the slider.

slider.name: min
slider.description: The min value of the input range. This value defaults to 0.

slider.name: max
slider.description: The max value of the input range. This value defaults to 0.

slider.name: step
slider.description: The step increment value of the input range. Example steps include 0.1, 1, or 10. This value defaults to 1.

slider.name: size
slider.description: The size value of the input range. This value default to empty, which is the base. Supports x-small, small, medium, and large.

slider.name: type
slider.description: The type of the input range position. This value defaults to horizontal.

slider.name: label
slider.description: The text label for the input range. Provide your own label to describe the slider. Otherwise, no label is displayed.

slider.name: disabled
slider.description: The disabled value of the input range. This value default to false.

slider.name: variant
slider.description: The variant changes the appearance of the slider. Accepted variants include standard and label-hidden. This value defaults to standard.

slider.name: messageWhenBadInput
slider.description: Error message to be displayed when a bad input is detected.

slider.name: messageWhenPatternMismatch
slider.description: Error message to be displayed when a pattern mismatch is detected.

slider.name: messageWhenTypeMismatch
slider.description: Error message to be displayed when a type mismatch is detected.

slider.name: messageWhenValueMissing
slider.description: Error message to be displayed when the value is missing.

slider.name: messageWhenRangeOverflow
slider.description: Error message to be displayed when a range overflow is detected.

slider.name: messageWhenRangeUnderflow
slider.description: Error message to be displayed when a range underflow is detected.

slider.name: messageWhenStepMismatch
slider.description: Error message to be displayed when a step mismatch is detected.

slider.name: messageWhenTooLong
slider.description: Error message to be displayed when the value is too long.

slider.name: onblur
slider.description: The action triggered when the slider releases focus.

slider.name: onfocus
slider.description: The action triggered when the slider receives focus.

spinner.name: size
spinner.description: The size of the spinner. Accepted sizes are small, medium, and large. This value defaults to medium.

spinner.name: variant
spinner.description: The variant changes the appearance of the spinner. Accepted variants are base, brand, and inverse. This value defaults to base.

spinner.name: alternativeText
spinner.description: The alternative text used to describe the reason for the wait and need for a spinner.

tab.name: id
tab.description: The optional ID is used during tabset's onselect event to determine which tab was clicked.

tab.name: label
tab.description: The text that appears on the tab. The attribute accepts string values, but for compatibility with previous releases also accepts a component type. Only the text portion of the label value displays and any CSS classes that are applied are ignored.

tab.name: iconName
tab.description: The Lightning Design System name of an icon to display to the left of the tab label. Specify the name in the format 'utility:down' where 'utility' is the category, and 'down' is the icon to be displayed. Only utility icons can be used in this component.

tab.name: iconAssistiveText
tab.description: Assistive text for the icon specified by iconName.

tab.name: showErrorIndicator
tab.description: Specifies whether there's an error in the tab content. An error icon is displayed to the right of the tab label.

tab.name: onactive
tab.description: The action triggered when this tab becomes active.

tabset.name: variant
tabset.description: The variant changes the appearance of the tabset. Accepted variants are default, scoped, and vertical.

tabset.name: selectedTabId
tabset.description: Allows you to set a specific tab to open by default. If this attribute is not used, the first tab opens by default.

tabset.name: onselect
tabset.description: The action that will run when the tab is clicked.

textarea.name: label
textarea.description: Text that describes the desired textarea input.

textarea.name: placeholder
textarea.description: Text that is displayed when the field is empty, to prompt the user for a valid entry.

textarea.name: maxlength
textarea.description: The maximum number of characters allowed in the textarea.

textarea.name: minlength
textarea.description: The minimum number of characters allowed in the textarea.

textarea.name: messageWhenBadInput
textarea.description: Error message to be displayed when a bad input is detected.

textarea.name: messageWhenValueMissing
textarea.description: Error message to be displayed when the value is missing.

textarea.name: messageWhenTooLong
textarea.description: Error message to be displayed when the value is too long.

textarea.name: messageWhenTooShort
textarea.description: Error message to be displayed when the value is too short.

tile.name: label

tile.name: href

tile.name: media
tile.description: The icon or figure that's displayed next to the textual information.

tree.name: items
tree.description: An array of key-value pairs that describe the tree. Keys include label, name, disabled, expanded, and items.

tree.name: header
tree.description: The text that's displayed as the tree heading.

tree.name: onselect
tree.description: The action triggered when a tree item is selected.

treeGrid.name: columns
treeGrid.description: Array of the columns object that's used to define the data types. Required properties include 'label', 'dataKey', and 'type'. The default type is 'text'.

treeGrid.name: data
treeGrid.description: The array of data to be displayed.

treeGrid.name: expandedRows
treeGrid.description: The array of unique row IDs that are expanded.

treeGrid.name: selectedRows
treeGrid.description: The array of unique row IDs that are selected

treeGrid.name: keyField
treeGrid.description: Required for better performance. Associates each row with a unique ID.

treeGrid.name: hideCheckboxColumn
treeGrid.description: Hides or displays the checkbox column for row selection. To hide the checkbox column, set hideCheckboxColumn to true. The default is false.

treeGrid.name: isLoading
treeGrid.description: Specifies whether more data is being loaded and displays a spinner if so. The default is false.

treeGrid.name: resizeColumnDisabled
treeGrid.description: Specifies whether column resizing is disabled. The default is false.

treeGrid.name: minColumnWidth
treeGrid.description: The minimum width for all columns. The default is 50px.

treeGrid.name: maxColumnWidth
treeGrid.description: The maximum width for all columns. The default is 1000px.

treeGrid.name: onrowselection
treeGrid.description: The action triggered when a row is selected.

treeGrid.name: onrowaction
treeGrid.description: The action triggered when an operation its clicked. By default its to closes the actions menu.

treeGrid.name: onresize
treeGrid.description: The action triggered when the table renders columns the first time and every time its resized an specific column.

treeGrid.name: ontoggle
treeGrid.description: The action triggered when a row is toggled (expanded or collapsed).

treeGrid.name: ontoggleall
treeGrid.description: The action triggered when all rows are toggled (expanded or collapsed).

treeGrid.name: showRowNumberColumn
treeGrid.description: Hides or displays the row number column. To show the row number column, set showRowNumberColumn to true. The default is false.

treeGrid.name: rowNumberOffset
treeGrid.description: Determines where to start counting the row number. The default is 0.

unsavedChanges.name: label
unsavedChanges.description: Label for the unsaved content which appears in prompt for save or discard

unsavedChanges.name: onsave
unsavedChanges.description: Action to handle saving unsaved content

unsavedChanges.name: ondiscard
unsavedChanges.description: Action to handle discarding unsaved content

verticalNavigation.name: compact
verticalNavigation.description: Specify true to reduce spacing between navigation items. This value defaults to false.

verticalNavigation.name: shaded
verticalNavigation.description: Specify true when the vertical navigation is sitting on top of a shaded background. This value defaults to false.

verticalNavigation.name: onbeforeselect
verticalNavigation.description: Action fired before an item is selected. The event params include the `name` of the selected item. To prevent the onselect handler from running, call event.preventDefault() in the onbeforeselect handler.

verticalNavigation.name: onselect
verticalNavigation.description: Action fired when an item is selected. The event params include the `name` of the selected item.

verticalNavigation.name: selectedItem
verticalNavigation.description: Name of the nagivation item to make active.

verticalNavigation.name: ariaLabel
verticalNavigation.description: The aria label attribute for the navigation component
