verticalNavigationItem.description: The text displayed for the navigation item.

verticalNavigationItem.name: name
verticalNavigationItem.description: A unique identifier for the navigation item.

verticalNavigationItem.name: href
verticalNavigationItem.description: The URL of the page that the navigation item goes to.

verticalNavigationItemBadge.name: label
verticalNavigationItemBadge.description: The text displayed for the navigation item.

verticalNavigationItemBadge.name: name
verticalNavigationItemBadge.description: A unique identifier for the navigation item.

verticalNavigationItemBadge.name: href
verticalNavigationItemBadge.description: The URL of the page that the navigation item goes to.

verticalNavigationItemBadge.name: badgeCount
verticalNavigationItemBadge.description: The number to show inside the badge. If this value is zero the badge will be hidden.

verticalNavigationItemBadge.name: assistiveText
verticalNavigationItemBadge.description: Assistive text describing the number in the badge. This is used to enhance accessibility and is not displayed to the user.

verticalNavigationItemIcon.name: label
verticalNavigationItemIcon.description: The text displayed for the navigation item.

verticalNavigationItemIcon.name: name
verticalNavigationItemIcon.description: A unique identifier for the navigation item.

verticalNavigationItemIcon.name: href
verticalNavigationItemIcon.description: The URL of the page that the navigation item goes to.

verticalNavigationItemIcon.name: iconName
verticalNavigationItemIcon.description: The Lightning Design System name of the icon. Names are written in the format 'utility:down' where 'utility' is the category, and 'down' is the specific icon to be displayed.

verticalNavigationSection.name: label
verticalNavigationSection.description: The heading text for this section.

availableForChatterExtensionRenderer.name: payload
availableForChatterExtensionRenderer.description: Payload preserved for this extension that is associated with this feed item.

availableForChatterExtensionRenderer.name: variant
availableForChatterExtensionRenderer.description: The variant changes based on where the extension is rendered. Valid values are FEED and PREVIEW. The value defaults to FEED

availableForFlowActions.name: timeout
availableForFlowActions.description: Maximum time (in seconds) an asynchronous call can take before returning control to the flow and executing the Local Action element's fault connector. The default value is 120. If the value is 0 or a negative number, the call never times out.

availableForFlowScreens.name: availableActions
availableForFlowScreens.description: The navigation actions available for this screen. Valid actions are NEXT, PREVIOUS, FINISH, and PAUSE.

availableForFlowScreens.name: navigateFlow
availableForFlowScreens.description: Reference the appropriate navigation action to move away from this screen.

availableForFlowScreens.name: validate
availableForFlowScreens.description: Custom validation to run when the flow is navigated to the next screen. Pass a function into this attribute that evaluates the component and returns values for isValid and errorMessage.

availableForFlowScreens.name: validate
availableForFlowScreens.description: Custom validation to run when the flow is navigated to the next screen. Pass a function into this attribute that evaluates the component and returns values for isValid and errorMessage.

hasPageReference.name: pageReference
hasPageReference.description: An object with a String 'type' property and Object 'attributes' and 'state' properties.

utilityItem.name: supportsPopOut
utilityItem.description: Controls the availability of pop-out functionality. Set to false to remove the pop-out option for the utility item.

backButton.name: iconName
backButton.description: The Lightning Design System name of the icon. Only utility icons can be used in this component.

backButton.name: onnavigationcomplete
backButton.description: Event handler action fired after every page navigation is complete. 'navigationcomplete' event provides 'canGoBack' boolean parameter value.

require.name: styles
require.description: The set of style sheets in dependency order that will be loaded.

require.name: scripts
require.description: The set of scripts in dependency order that will be loaded.

hasEventContext.description: READONLY - An object representing the item context pertinent to the appointment.

hasEventContext.description: READONLY - The location of the current event.

hasItemContext.name: mode
hasItemContext.description: READONLY - An enum indicating the mode of the item. Possible values are 'view', 'edit'

hasItemContext.name: source
hasItemContext.description: READONLY - An enum indicating where the source is coming from. Possible values are 'email', 'event'

hasItemContext.description: READONLY - An object representing the contacts on the current item.

hasItemContext.name: subject
hasItemContext.description: READONLY - The subject of the current item.

hasItemContext.name: messageBody
hasItemContext.description: READONLY - The body of the current item in plain text

feed.name: feedDesign
feed.description: Valid values include DEFAULT ( shows inline comments on desktop, a bit more detail ) or BROWSE ( primarily an overview of the feed items )

feed.name: type
feed.description: The strategy used to find items associated with the subject. Valid values include: Bookmarks, Company, DirectMessages, Feeds, Files, Filter, Groups, Home, Moderation, Mute, News, PendingReview, Record, Streams, To, Topics, UserProfile.

feed.name: subjectId
feed.description: For most feeds tied to an entity, this is used specified the desired entity. Defaults to the current user if not specified

fullFeed.name: type
fullFeed.description: The strategy used to find items associated with the subject. Valid values include: News, Home, Record, To.

fullFeed.name: subjectId
fullFeed.description: For most feeds tied to an entity, this is used specified the desired entity. Defaults to the current user if not specified

fullFeed.name: handleNavigationEvents
fullFeed.description: Should this component handle navigation events for entities and urls. If true then navigation events will result in the entity or url being opened in a new window.

publisher.name: context
publisher.description: The context in which the component is being displayed (RECORD or GLOBAL). RECORD is for a record feed, and GLOBAL is for all other feed types. This attribute is case-sensitive.

navigationMenuBase.name: menuItems
navigationMenuBase.description: Automatically populated with menu item’s data. This attribute is read-only.

routeLink.name: id
routeLink.description: The ID of the anchor tag.

routeLink.name: class
routeLink.description: A CSS class for the anchor tag.

routeLink.name: title
routeLink.description: The text to display for the link tooltip.

routeLink.name: label
routeLink.description: The text displayed in the link.

routeLink.name: routeInput
routeLink.description: The map of dynamic parameters that create the link. Only recordId-based routes are supported.

routeLink.name: onClick
routeLink.description: Action to trigger when the anchor is clicked.

waveDashboard.name: recordId
waveDashboard.description: Id of the current entity in the context of which the component is being displayed.

waveDashboard.name: dashboardId
waveDashboard.description: The unique ID of the dashboard. You can get a dashboard’s ID, an 18-character code beginning with 0FK, from the dashboard's URL, or you can request it through the API. This attribute can be used instead of the developer name, but it can't be included if the name has been set. One of the two is required.

waveDashboard.name: developerName
waveDashboard.description: The unique developer name of the dashboard. You can request the developer name through the API. This attribute can be used instead of the dashboard ID, but it can't be included if the ID has been set. One of the two is required

waveDashboard.name: hideOnError
waveDashboard.description: Controls whether or not users see a dashboard that has an error. When this attribute is set to true, if the dashboard has an error, it won’t appear on the page. When set to false, the dashboard appears but doesn’t show any data. An error can occur when a user doesn't have access to the dashboard or it has been deleted.

waveDashboard.name: height
waveDashboard.description: Specifies the height of the dashboard, in pixels.

waveDashboard.name: showSharing
waveDashboard.description: If true, and the dashboard is shareable, then the dashboard shows the Share icon. If false, the dashboard doesn't show the Share icon. To show the Share icon in the dashboard, the smallest supported frame size is 800 x 612 pixels.

waveDashboard.name: showTitle
waveDashboard.description: If true, the dashboard’s title is included above the dashboard. If false, the dashboard appears without a title.

waveDashboard.name: showHeader
waveDashboard.description: If true, the dashboard is displayed with a header bar that includes dashboard information and controls. If false, the dashboard appears without a header bar. Note that the header bar automatically appears when either showSharing or showTitle is true.

waveDashboard.name: rendered
waveDashboard.description: Specifies whether or not the component is rendered on the page.

waveDashboard.name: filter
waveDashboard.description: Adds selections or filters to the embedded dashboard at runtime. The filter attribute is configured using JSON. For filtering by dimension, use this syntax: {'datasets' : {'dataset1': [ {'fields': ['field1'], 'selection': ['$value1', '$value2']}, {'fields': ['field2'], 'filter': { 'operator': 'operator1', 'values': ['$value3', '$value4']}}]}}. For filtering on measures, use this syntax: {'datasets' : {'dataset1': [ {'fields': ['field1'], 'selection': ['$value1', '$value2']}, {'fields': ['field2'], 'filter': { 'operator': 'operator1', 'values': [[$value3]]}}]}}. With the selection option, the dashboard is shown with all its data, and the specified dimension values are highlighted. With the filter option, the dashboard is shown with only filtered data. For more information, see https://help.salesforce.com/articleView?id=bi_embed_community_builder.htm.

waveDashboard.name: openLinksInNewWindow
waveDashboard.description: If false, links to other dashboards will be opened in the same window.

waveDashboard.name: accessToken
waveDashboard.description: A valid access token obtained by logging into Salesforce. Useful when the component is used by Lightning Out in a non-Salesforce domain.
